plugins.name: Typecetera
plugins.description:
Easily create and fine-tune custom fonts directly within Figma. Main features include:

A Glyphs library to manage all your characters, live previews to test fonts on the go, and real-time Kerning adjustments for perfect spacing. No need to export or install—just design, adjust, and Use your custom fonts instantly in your projects. Ideal for both beginners and type enthusiasts looking for a smarter, more integrated approach to typography!
plugins.tagline: Create your own fonts—effortlessly, right inside Figma.

plugins.name: Fake Content Maker (free)
plugins.description:
Use AI and ChatGPT to make fake content for your designs.!


Fake Content Maker is a straight-forward Figma Plugin where you enter in your OpenAI key, and then can enter in a prompt to generate your own fake content.


👋🏻 First things first:

  1. 100% free: no payment or fees required
  2. Create your own OpenAI token so you pay only for what you use


🧐 How it works:

  1. Open up Fake Content Maker, and enter in the kind of content you want to make / generate
  2. Enter in your OpenAI token so that you only pay for what you generate (around $0.01 for every 10 generations)


🆓 Free to use, but pay for ChatGPT API usage:

  1. While this plugin is 100% free, you'll need to pay for any OpenAI or ChatGPT requests made by the plugin


🛟 Feedback:

  1. We'd love any ideas or questions you have: feedback@berryplugins.com
  2. Leave a comment if you want to tell people how great this plugin is


🎉🎉🎉
plugins.tagline: Use ChatGPT to insert fake content into your design

plugins.name: KEEK.design — плагин для Figma
plugins.description:
KEEK — это второй пилот для UX/UI продуктовых дизайнеров и команд.


Мы скриншотим сервисы, аккуратно складываем их по папочкам и сценариям, чтобы вам не пришлось. Держим всё в актуальном состоянии и постоянно обновляем.


Уже собрали более 500 экранов мобильных приложений, веб и ТВ-сервисов.


Плагин дополняет функционал сайта app.keek.design. Пользователи могут искать, выбирать и вставлять нужные сценарии и скриншоты прямо в Figma, чтобы ничего не отвлекало их от решения клиентих задач.


Чтобы пользоваться плагином, необходимо авторизоваться в KEEK через Figma.

Доступно только на русском языке.
plugins.tagline: Срикншотим приложения и сервисы, чтобы вам не пришлось

plugins.name: Text Contrast
plugins.description:
The fastest contrast checker in the galaxy! 


Text Contrast lets you instantly run a AA or AAA contrast report on all text across your selected mockups before you can blink.


Simply select a frames, groups, or components, and hit Check.

A detailed report will automatically display next to your artboard, giving you immediate feedback on color contrast compliance.


Hot Features:

  1. The plugin quickly calculates contrast ratios between text and its background, ensuring compliance with WCAG 2.2 standards.


  1. No need to be an expert, results appear instantly as a visual copy next to the original, with a focus on contrast and font size.


  1. The plugin won’t alter your design. Results are shown as an overlay, maintaining your original layout.


  1. Select your artboard, click "CHECK", and voilà! Get immediate results without leaving your workflow. 


How It Works:

  1. Easy Interaction: Select your artboard and click "CHECK." The plugin analyzes the contrast between the text color and its parent fill color.


  1. Focused Analysis: The calculation is based on the contrast ratio and font sizes, providing fast, accurate results for single color text layers. 


Limitations:

  1. The plugin operates over frames, groups, and components but only supports one artboard at a time.


  1. It currently does not support gradients or mixed color/font size text layers.


This is my first plugin, so feel free to share any feedback ♥️
plugins.tagline: Figure out text contrast issues reported directly on the artboard.

plugins.name: Name Slayer
plugins.description:
Slay your layer names

  1. Select layer(s) with styles or variables directly applied to them (color, text and effect).
  2. Preview how many layers will be renamed, already match their style/variable name, have no styles applied, or if part of your selection has more than one style/variable applied to the same layer.
  3. Click Rename layer!


This plugin is a great complement to Styler, when style names and layer names become out of sync.


Notes

  1. Name Slayer supports color variables and color styles applied to either a fill or stroke, as well as text styles and effect styles.
  2. Layers with more than one style or variable can’t be renamed – layers must have a single style or variable to know what to rename it to.
  3. Styles which alias variables will be rename to the style, not the variable within.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer • Plugin Author • Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Easily rename layers to match the name of their applied styles and variables.

plugins.name: Currency Formatter
plugins.description:
Effortlessly convert currencies and reformat them with a single click. From quick exchanges (e.g., 4 USD → 347.52 INR ) to precise formatting (e.g.,347 INR → ₹347), this plugin simplifies currency management and saves you time.


🚀 How does it work?


1️⃣ Select the text you want to convert or format.

2️⃣ Choose the currency for conversion or pick a format type.

3️⃣ Done! The plugin handles the rest. 🎉


It’s that simple—designed to save you time and effort.


If you have any suggestions or inquiries, feel free to reach out to me on Twitter.


If you appreciate my work, consider showing your support by buying me a coffee.
plugins.tagline: Convert. Format. Simplify – All in One Click!

plugins.name: GradientForge - Free mesh gradients
plugins.description:
This tool allows you to create beautiful mesh gradients with customizable color points. You can:

  1. Add and remove color points
  2. Adjust colors using the color picker
  3. Change the aspect ratio
  4. Save your gradients as PNG files

The gradients are generated using WebGL and RBF interpolation for smooth performance and high-quality output.


Website version: https://pkolesnikov.com/meshgradients
plugins.tagline: Customizable gradients generator

plugins.name: Orange Tokens: Themes & Variables
plugins.description:
Description

Orange Tokens helps you turn any base color into a full set of tints and shades — instantly and intelligently. Now with Typography Token support, you can generate consistent, scalable color and type systems right inside Figma.


Whether you're building a new design system or scaling an existing one, Orange Tokens eliminates guesswork and manual setup — so you can focus on design, not variables.


No more manual tweaks or guesswork — Orange Tokens helps you scale your colors the smart way.


🚀 How to use

  1. Enter your base colors and name them
  2. Choose how many display/text styles you want
  3. Click “Generate Variables”
  4. Orange Tokens generates color variables and synced text styles automatically


✨ Features

  1. One-click color palette generation
  2. Auto-generated tints & shades from base colors
  3. Typography tokens + text styles generated together
  4. Organized variables with design token–friendly naming
  5. Great for theming, dark/light modes, and scalable systems
  6. Fast, clean, and easy — even at scale


⚙️ How it works

Orange Tokens uses structured algorithms to create harmonious tints, shades, and typography styles from your input. Each color or text style is mapped to a logical name and stored as a Figma variable — ready for use across your entire system.


Everything updates in a few clicks — no broken styles, no messy overrides.


💬 Feedback and feature ideas?

This is just the beginning — future updates will explore typography tokens, spacing, mode support, and more. Have an idea or request? Email me at inamdar.chinmay25@gmail.com, or leave a comment on the plugin page!
plugins.tagline: Design Token Generator for Color & Typography

plugins.name: Zimmar - Accessibility Compliance Checker
plugins.description:
Zimmar is a free Figma plugin that checks for accessibility compliance issues and helps you fix them.


Many designers face challenges in spotting issues like small text, poor color contrast, or improperly spaced touch targets. I wanted to build a tool that would empower designers to spot and fix these issues right within Figma.


Zimmar is designed to seamlessly integrate with Figma and provide designers with quick, actionable insights.


Here’s how it helps:


  1. Scans your design for font size, contrast, and touch target issues.
  2. Flags areas where improvements are needed based on accessibility standards like WCAG.
  3. Provides suggestions to help you fix issues and improve your designs right away.
  4. Provides accessibility compliance overview on a single selection.
  5. Generates CSV or JSON reports of detected issues for further analysis.


This plugin isn’t just about checking boxes - it’s about raising awareness and making accessibility an integral part of the design process. By addressing these issues early, I strongly believe, we can create experiences that are truly inclusive and reach a wider audience.


Your comments and feedback are appreciated!
plugins.tagline: Scan your designs for font size, contrast, and touch target issues and resolve them instantly

plugins.name: Peppercorn - Find Centroids (Visual Center)
plugins.description:
Find the geometric center (centroid) of vector shapes.

This experimental plugin calculates the centroid to determine the center of shapes.

👉 Usage

  1. Place your shape in a container for better experience
  2. Select the shape
  3. Run the plugin


⚠️ Note

  1. This plugin is experimental and may not work perfectly for all shapes
  2. The centroid method works best for simple and symmetrical shapes
  3. For complex or highly irregular shapes, the centroid may not always represent the visual center


🛠️ Future Updates

  1. We plan to add visual guides to help you understand the centroid's position
  2. Considering additional methods like the smallest enclosing circle for more complex shapes

accepted.name: Alexandre Broudin
accepted.description:
Product Designer.
From design to code.
linkedin.com/in/alexandrebroudin/
💸 If you like my work, buy me a croissant 🥐 or a coffee ☕️ :) paypal.me/abroudin

plugins.tagline: Precision, not guesswork: Unveil the true center of your shapes!

plugins.name: Quick Mode
plugins.description:
Apply modes for selected objects with quick actions and use autocomplete search instead of looking for a small button in the Figma UI and digging through dropdowns.


The plugin enables you to search through local collections and remote collections which are enabled in the current file.


Select the objects you want to switch modes for and run the plugin. If nothing is selected the plugin would switch modes for the current page.
plugins.tagline: Switch modes quickly with keyboard only 🚀

99027.description:

Select the objects you want to switch modes for and run the plugin. If nothing is selected the plugin would switch modes for the current page.

plugins.name: Ideas Spark Booth・Private Brainstorming & Retrospective Sessions
plugins.description:
Ideas Spark Booth is currently in beta. We welcome your feedback.


Ideas Spark Booth empowers your team with a powerful FigJam and Slides plugin for conducting focused brainstorming and retrospective sessions with complete participant privacy.


---


Share your ideas and submit your feedback at a single place: ideas-spark-booth.canny.io


---


Why Ideas Spark Booth


Engage with Better Brainstorming Activities

○ Set clear collaboration guidelines and establish time limits to maintain focus

○ Organize ideas into simple categories

○ Use FigJam for live brainstorming or Slides for instant team feedback


Enable Efficient Ideas Sharing

○ Track participation and engagement in real-time

○ Focus on creativity without interruptions

○ Review and refine before sharing


Present and Analyze the Insights

○ Look back at past brainstorming sessions

○ Export session data into presentation slides

○ Save your results as spreadsheets


Publish & Explore Activities

○ Store activities in the cloud

○ Share with other users

○ Browse and use community activities


---


Useful Links


Have Help

○ Read the documentation

○ Contact support


Get Involved

○ Submit feedback

○ Request a feature


Give Support

○ Follow the author


---


If you find Ideas Spark Booth useful, please share it with your colleagues!


---


○ Browser complete compatibility: Figma Desktop App, Google Chrome, Opera, Microsoft Edge, and other Chromium-based browsers

○ Partial compatibility: Mozilla Firefox, Apple Safari


---


The plugin is open-source. Feel free to both watch or fork the repository, or request a merge.


Made by Aurélien Grimaud, Senior Product Designer based in Paris.
plugins.tagline: Engage & Enable your participants through private team sessions for brainstorming and retrospectives

Made by Aurélien Grimaud, Senior Product Designer based in Paris.

plugins.name: CoverCraft - Figma x Hashnode
plugins.description:
Are you creating cover images for your Hashnode Post ? Constantly downloading, naming, renaming files and switching platforms just to ensure your cover image looks perfect. We've been there, and we understand your frustration.


But fret not, because CoverCraft is here to save the day! Say goodbye to all the hassle and frustration. With CoverCraft, certainly no more platform switching.


Imagine being able to craft your cover images in Figma and seamlessly set them on your Hashnode blog posts with just a few clicks. That's the power of CoverCraft - simplifying your workflow and allowing you to focus on what truly matters: crafting your cover.


Features:


Firstly, To Unlock the full potential of CoverCraft you need access token. Don't have a token yet? No worries – create access token


1) Set Cover Images:


  • While plugin is open, Select image or frame containing your cover image. Next, choose the post in which you want to set the selected image as the cover, currently we support published post.
  • Finally, Click Set as Cover to apply the selected image or frame as the cover for the chosen post.


2) Generate your Imagination:


  • We discovered that users often struggled with selecting the perfect background image. To address this, Introducing Lexica AI into plugin to Generate Images from Prompt. Search for Background Images based on your imagination.
  • Open plugin and run in file where you aim to build Cover Image.
  • Navigate to the Search Cover Tab, Enter your imaginative prompt to initiate the Search. Browse through the generated images and select the one that resonates with your vision.
  • Witness the magic by clicking on image and make your cover. Once your newly created cover image is ready, set without ever leaving Figma.


3) Dark and Light Mode Support:


  • Our plugin seamlessly integrates with Figma's preference theme, offering support for both dark and light modes. This means that regardless of your chosen theme in Figma, our plugin will automatically adjust its appearance to match.
  • This ensures a consistent and comfortable user experience. If preferred working theme is dark, our plugin will automatically detect and switch to dark mode. Conversely, if you opt for a light theme, the plugin will effortlessly transition to light mode.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly Set Cover Images from Figma to Hashnode

plugins.name: Halftone Converter
plugins.description:
This tool transforms any selected image into a customizable halftone effect, using individual ellipse layers to simulate tonal shading. You can control:


•Dot Size – Adjust the diameter of each dot to refine visual granularity

•Dot Density – Increase or decrease how many dots are used to represent the image


Once applied, the halftone output is placed in a Figma frame as editable ellipses, allowing for manual adjustment, recoloring, or animation. It’s ideal for designers looking to stylize artwork with a print-inspired, dot-matrix look.
plugins.tagline: Transform any image into editable halftone dots. Adjust size, density, and style directly in Figma.

137209.name: Halftone Converter
137209.description:

•Dot Density – Increase or decrease how many dots are used to represent the image


Once applied, the halftone output is placed in a Figma frame as editable ellipses, allowing for manual adjustment, recoloring, or animation. It’s ideal for designers looking to stylize artwork with a print-inspired, dot-matrix look.
137209.tagline: Transform any image into editable halftone dots. Adjust size, density, and style directly in Figma.

plugins.name: Bulk image exporter
plugins.description:
Speed up your workflow by exporting all images from your Figma page in just one click! This plugin collects every image and packs them into a handy ZIP file — no more exporting one by one.


You can also set a size limit (default: 1MB) to automatically compress images without losing too much quality. Perfect for quick exporting, sharing assets with devs and optimizing performance.


Features:


  1. Export all images on the current page in a ZIP file
  2. Set max size per image (e.g. 1MB or less)
  3. Check the current download status.
  4. Download each image individually


👉 Please note: this plugin is currently in beta, feedback is welcome!

accepted.name: Lorenzo Brandimarte
accepted.description: Web and UI Designer | No-code developer

plugins.tagline: Export every image on your page in a single ZIP

plugins.name: Better Node Inspector
plugins.description:
Better Node Inspector by Dualite, offers a range of capabilities for examining node properties. The interface streamlines the process of inspecting node characteristics.


Users can access general properties, positional attributes, flex and auto-layout settings, fill properties, view child elements, and explore additional properties not covered in the main categories


Open-source repo: https://github.com/dualiteindia/better-node-inspector


  1. The plugin utilizes the async Figma API
  2. Node child elements are only loaded when the user clicks on the children dropdown, significantly enhancing plugin performance and making it super fast.


Usage

Simply select a node in your project, and Better Node Inspector will display its properties in an easy-to-navigate interface.

accepted.name: Dualite
accepted.description: 🍜 Figma plugin for converting interactive prototypes to code

plugins.tagline: Better Node Inspector by Dualite is a plugin designed to help developers inspect a given Figma Node.

plugins.name: QR Fast Generator
plugins.description:
📌 QR Fast Generator

QR Fast Generator es una herramienta rápida y sencilla para generar códigos QR personalizados directamente en Figma. Con soporte para múltiples formatos, permite crear códigos QR para enlaces, contactos, redes Wi-Fi y más, optimizando tu flujo de trabajo en diseño.


Ya sea para compartir información de contacto, redirigir a un enlace o generar accesos rápidos a plataformas como WhatsApp, QR Fast Generator te permite hacerlo en segundos, con opciones de personalización de color y tamaño. 🚀


Características Principales

  1. 🔗 Múltiples Tipos de QR: Crea códigos QR para URLs, WhatsApp, contactos (vCard), redes Wi-Fi y teléfonos en segundos.
  2. 🎨 Personalización Completa: Ajusta el color del QR, el fondo y el tamaño para adaptarlo a tu diseño.
  3. ⚡ Envío Directo a Figma: Genera el QR y agrégalo al documento de Figma con un solo clic, sin salir del plugin.
  4. 📥 Descarga Rápida: Guarda el QR en tu dispositivo en formato PNG para usarlo en otros proyectos.


¿Cómo Usarlo?

  1. Selecciona el Tipo de QR: Escoge entre URL, WhatsApp, Teléfono, vCard o Wi-Fi.
  2. Introduce los Datos: Completa los campos necesarios según el tipo de QR seleccionado.
  3. Personaliza el Diseño: Ajusta el color del código, el fondo y el tamaño.
  4. Genera y Visualiza el QR: Obtén una vista previa del código QR en tiempo real.
  5. Descarga o Envíalo a Figma: Guarda la imagen en tu dispositivo o insértala directamente en Figma con un solo clic.


Mejoras y Feedback

🚀 ¿Tienes ideas para mejorar QR Fast Generator? mándame un mensajini! 😎✨
plugins.tagline: QR Fast Generator es una herramienta rápida y sencilla para generar códigos QR

plugins.name: Component Arranger
plugins.description:
Component Arranger is a powerful Figma plugin that helps designers and developers organize their components with magazine-style precision. Key features include:


Set custom magazine dimensions (width and height in pixels)

Input component names with square bracket notation

Support for multiple component arrangements

Perfect for magazine and editorial layouts

Easy-to-use interface for quick component organization


Ideal for teams working on editorial designs, magazines, and content-heavy layouts that require precise component arrangement and naming conventions.

plugins.name: Palette to Variable
plugins.description:
Palette to Variable streamlines your design system color management by automatically generating professional color variations from a single base color.


Key Features:

• Generate up to 20 perfectly balanced color shades

• Preview all variations before generating

• Create color variables automatically in your chosen collection

• Get instant documentation with color values and usage

• Supports both light and dark themes


Perfect for:

• Design System Engineers

• UI/UX Designers

• Design Teams

• Brand Developers


Save hours of manual color creation while maintaining consistency across your design system. Simply choose your base color, preview the generated shades, and let the plugin handle the rest - from variable creation to documentation.


Built with Figma's native variable system for seamless integration into your workflow. No external dependencies, no complex setup - just efficient color system generation when you need it.
plugins.tagline: Generate Color Systems, Effortlessly

plugins.name: Shopdev: Figma to Shopify Liquid
plugins.description:
Figma to Shopify Liquid

Turn any Figma design into responsive Liquid code that’s ready to publish to your Shopify theme with the Shopdev Figma plugin. Select your frame in Figma, import it into Shopdev, and deploy in a few clicks, no coding required.


How it works

  1. Open the plugin: Launch the plugin directly within your Figma design file.
  2. Select the frame: Choose any frame, like a hero, banner, testimonial, or promo section.
  3. Click “Import frame”: The plugin automatically transfers your selected design to shopdev.ai.
  4. Customize prompt (Optional): You’ll see a pre-filled prompt “Build this Figma import”; you have the option to add extra input if desired (e.g., "Use a slider for the images on mobile").
  5. Submit the prompt: Shopdev will generate responsive Liquid code you can preview.
  6. Edit and iterate: Continue prompting shopdev to refine your design until it’s perfect.
  7. Publish: Click to deploy directly to your Shopify theme.


Support

For additional support using this plugin, ask questions in the Shopdev Discord channel.


Tips for best results: Use Auto Layout

Auto Layout isn’t required, but it helps the AI better understand your design’s structure and spacing. Using it can lead to more accurate imports with less additional prompting needed, especially for responsive layouts.


From Figma to Shopify with the help of Shopdev, an AI Shopify developer

With the Shopdev Figma plugin, you can convert any static Figma design into live, editable Shopify theme sections, ideal for:

  1. Homepage sections like banners, product features, testimonials, or value props
  2. Landing page sections that can be reused across multiple campaigns
  3. PDP add-ons like trust badges, comparison charts, or upsell modules
  4. Reusable content blocks that can be dragged and dropped across templates
  5. Custom sections for any part of your store without needing a developer


Shopdev automatically interprets your Figma design and generates responsive Liquid code that works natively within Shopify’s theme system. You can edit the output manually or continue refining it through prompts.
plugins.tagline: Use AI to turn any Figma design into Shopify-ready Liquid code

136273.name: Shopdev: Figma to Shopify Liquid

  5. Submit the prompt: Shopdev will generate responsive Liquid code you can preview.

136273.tagline: Use AI to turn any Figma design into Shopify-ready Liquid code

plugins.name: Figma Audit Annotations
plugins.description:
The Audit Annotations Figma's plugin allows your team to collaboratively run a full usability, accessibility or ecodesign audit by adding qualified annotations to your workflows' screens using well-known referentials such Bastien & Scapin usability heuristics (others to come).


The plugin automatically calculates a score for each screen and for the whole audited application.


Finally, you can export all your annotations into an actionable audit file for your clients. (Not yet available)


More details on the dedicated page: https://alconis.com/ressources/figma_audit_annotations_plugin/


This plugin will be regularly improved based on community feedbacks.

accepted.name: Nicolas Demange
accepted.description: French Product Designer... and developer! Saving the world. One screen at a time.

plugins.tagline: Annotate your screens with usability, accessibility and ecodesign referentials.

- Fix a bug where the form was closed when someone else added an annotation.

plugins.name: Website Accessibility Checker by Detachless
plugins.description:
Make Your Website Design Accessible for Everyone with Website Accessibilty Checker by Detachless! 🌍


Empower your designs with inclusivity using Website Accessibilty Checker by Detachless.

Select any frame in Figma and instantly:

✔️ Check color contrast to ensure visibility 🎨

✔️ Analyze text size for better readability 🔍

✔️ Review readability metrics for clarity ✏️


All insights are categorized for easy review and actionable improvements. 🚀


🎉 Bonus: Publish your accessible designs directly as websites with Detachless – no coding needed! 💻🌐

accepted.name: Detachless
accepted.description: Publish website directly from Figma to web or export your Figma designs as code ✨

accepted.name: Lazar Krstić
accepted.description: Building Detachless, a tool that helps you to publish your website directly from Figma to web.

plugins.tagline: Make your Figma website accessible and inclusive with quick, actionable insights!

plugins.name: Row Column Styler
plugins.description:
Row Column Styler is your go-to plugin for streamlining design workflows when dealing with tables, grids, or any layout that involves rows and columns. Here's what you can expect from the plugin:


- 🎨 Customizable Colors: Apply your desired colors to even and odd rows or columns effortlessly.

- 📏 Automatic Alignment: Use the *tidy-up* feature to neatly align and distribute rows or columns, making your designs pixel-perfect.

- 👀 Live Preview: See how your colors and layouts will look in real-time with our interactive preview.

- 🖱️ User-Friendly Interface: Switch between row and column styling with a simple click—no complex settings required.

- ⚡ Quick Application: Apply styles instantly with the "Apply" button, saving you time on repetitive tasks.


Whether you're creating data tables or stylized layouts, Row Column Styler makes the process smoother and faster.
plugins.tagline: "Effortlessly style and preview rows or columns in Figma with custom colors and alignment."

plugins.name: Figma to Creatopy
plugins.description:
Boost your workflow by importing Figma designs directly into Creatopy—work faster, collaborate better, and scale effortlessly.


Key Features


  1. Quick Import:

Easily import selected Figma frames into a project and folder of your choice in Creatopy.

  1. Import as single design or set: Set import is available for multiple identical frames provided the layers have the same name and are of the same type.
  2. Smart Layer Mapping: Figma layers (images, text, shapes) are auto-converted to matching Creatopy layers.
  3. Editable Elements: All imported elements stay editable—tweak designs, animate, or scale with automation.
  4. Preserved Structure: Figma’s nested groups stay intact, keeping your design organized and easy to navigate.



Current Version Limitations


  1. Frame properties are removed; frames become groups.
  2. No support for auto layout and constraints.
  3. Limited support for blend modes, strokes, effects, gradients, and corner radius.



Streamline your process. Scale your creativity. Try “Figma to Creatopy” and design smarter from the start.
plugins.tagline: Boost your workflow by importing Figma designs directly into Creatopy.

136819.name: Figma to Creatopy
136819.description:
Boost your workflow by importing Figma designs directly into Creatopy—work faster, collaborate better, and scale effortlessly.


Key Features


  1. Quick Import:

Easily import selected Figma frames into a project and folder of your choice in Creatopy.

  1. Import as single design or set: Set import is available for multiple identical frames provided the layers have the same name and are of the same type.
  2. Smart Layer Mapping: Figma layers (images, text, shapes) are auto-converted to matching Creatopy layers.
  3. Editable Elements: All imported elements stay editable—tweak designs, animate, or scale with automation.
  4. Preserved Structure: Figma’s nested groups stay intact, keeping your design organized and easy to navigate.



Current Version Limitations


  1. Frame properties are removed; frames become groups.
  2. No support for auto layout and constraints.
  3. Limited support for blend modes, strokes, effects, gradients, and corner radius.



Streamline your process. Scale your creativity. Try “Figma to Creatopy” and design smarter from the start.

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin needs to access the Creatopy API to generate ads and fetch fonts. The plugin also needs to access Figma's API to create and manipulate design elements.

136819.release_notes:
We’ve added several improvements in this update:
- Optimized the asset upload process for better performance
- Resolved rotation issues for elements nested in rotated groups
- The plugin now considers only the first visible fill property of each layer
- Fixed issues related to mapping font attributes and styles
- Added support for multi-line text layers
136819.tagline: Boost your workflow by importing Figma designs directly into Creatopy.

plugins.name: Symplr.io - Figma to a working App in minutes
plugins.description:
What is Symplr.io?

Symplr.io is a cutting-edge low-code platform designed to empower anyone to create production-ready web and mobile apps effortlessly. Symplr.io allows users to rapidly compose innovative apps covering a broad range of domains such as fintech, open finance & e-commerce.


What Does This Plugin Do?

The Symplr.io - Figma to Functional App Instantly plugin bridges the gap between design and development. It enables the users to convert a Figma design into a working app by seamlessly importing the Figma design into the Symplr Studio. The users can extend the imported app by adding API workflows and business logic within Symplr Studio.


What Can You Do in Symplr.io Studio?

  1. Add Logic & APIs: Use Symplr's intuitive low-code tools to define business logic and integrate APIs, leveraging the Arazzo Workflow Specification for seamless API integrations.
  2. Build, Test, & Deploy: Build your app, test its functionality, and deploy the code directly to your GitHub repository.


How to Use the Plugin

  1. Install the Symplr.io - Figma to Functional App Instantly plugin from the Figma Marketplace.
  2. Using the plugin interface, tag your Figma components to match Symplr’s widget library.
  3. Import your tagged Figma designs to Symplr.io.
  4. View your auto-generated app.
  5. Enhance your app by adding business logic and APIs (Arazzo specification-based workflows).
  6. Build and test your mobile app directly from Symplr.io.

Note: Currently, Symplr.io supports mobile apps with React Native.


Create your next mobile app seamlessly, from design to deployment, with Symplr.io! (https://studio.symplr.io)
plugins.tagline: Instantly convert Figma designs into production-ready, mobile apps.
